always_included_messages.content: Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.

name: root

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"

msg.content: Could you construct a 3-day journey for two people from Chicago to Albany that takes place from March 22nd to March 24th, 2022? Our budget is $2,300. We require accommodations that allow smoking and should ideally be entire rooms. We will not be self-driving during this trip. On the subject of cuisine, we're open to any suggestions you might have.

Could you construct a 3-day journey for two people from Chicago to Albany that takes place from March 22nd to March 24th, 2022? Our budget is $2,300. We require accommodations that allow smoking and should ideally be entire rooms. We will not be self-driving during this trip. On the subject of cuisine, we're open to any suggestions you might have.

msg.content:
# Chicago to Albany

Here is a 3-day itinerary for your trip from Chicago to Albany, with all the necessary considerations in mind.

## Day 1: Tuesday, March 22nd, 2022
- 13:21: Take a 1 hour and 57-minute flight from Chicago O'Hare International Airport to Albany International Airport.
- 16:18: Check into your accommodation, the Sunny, 1 Bedroom in Bedstuy, Brooklyn apartment at 160 dollars per night. This entire home/apt accommodation allows smoking and is rated 4 stars. It is located at 12210, USA.
- 18:00: Head to Kaiser, a highly rated cafe, pizza, and American restaurant with an average cost of 96 dollars.

## Day 2: Wednesday, March 23rd, 2022
- 9:00: Start the day with a visit to the Albany Institute of History & Art. Here, you can learn about the city's past and explore a range of exhibits. The institute is located at 125 Washington Ave, Albany, NY 12210, USA and can be contacted at (518) 463-4478.
- 12:00: After the museum visit, stop by Starvin' Marvin, a tea, cafe, Mexican, and Indian restaurant with an average cost of 20 dollars.
- 13:30: Travel to the New York State Museum, located at 222 Madison Ave, Albany, NY 12230, USA. Here, you can delve deeper into the history and culture of the state, with exhibits covering various topics. The museum can be contacted at (518) 474-5877.
- 16:30: Spend some time at the Schuyler Mansion State Historic Site, located at 32 Catherine St, Albany, NY 12202, USA. This site offers a glimpse into the past with its historic mansion and surrounding grounds. The site can be contacted at (518) 434-0834.
- 18:30: For dinner, try out Jahangeer Foods, a highly rated tea, pizza, Italian, BBQ, and cafe restaurant with an average cost of 59 dollars.

## Day 3: Thursday, March 24th, 2022
- 9:00: Head to the Albany Pine Bush Preserve, located at 195 New Karner Rd Suite 1, Albany, NY 12205, USA. This natural area offers hiking trails and the chance to connect with nature. The preserve can be contacted at (518) 456-0655.
- 12:00: Have lunch at Urban Punjab, a desserts, tea, pizza, Indian, Mediterranean, and seafood restaurant with an average cost of 63 dollars.
- 13:30: Check out the Discover Albany Visitors Center, located at 25 Quackenbush Square, Albany, NY 12207, USA. This centre provides information about the city and its attractions, along with potential discounts and special offers. Call (518) 434-1217 for more information.
- 15:00: Visit the Washington Park Lake House, situated at Washington Park Rd, Albany, NY 12203, USA. This park offers a peaceful retreat in the city, with a lake and surrounding greenery.
- 17:00: End your trip with a visit to the New York State Capitol, located at State St. and Washington Ave, Albany, NY 12224, USA. This impressive building holds significant political and historical value and can be contacted at (518) 474-2418.

Please be aware that the itinerary has been created with the information available to me and is, therefore, subject to change.

Enjoy your trip!

# Chicago to Albany

Here is a 3-day itinerary for your trip from Chicago to Albany, with all the necessary considerations in mind.

## Day 1: Tuesday, March 22nd, 2022
- 13:21: Take a 1 hour and 57-minute flight from Chicago O'Hare International Airport to Albany International Airport.
- 16:18: Check into your accommodation, the Sunny, 1 Bedroom in Bedstuy, Brooklyn apartment at 160 dollars per night. This entire home/apt accommodation allows smoking and is rated 4 stars. It is located at 12210, USA.
- 18:00: Head to Kaiser, a highly rated cafe, pizza, and American restaurant with an average cost of 96 dollars.

## Day 2: Wednesday, March 23rd, 2022
- 9:00: Start the day with a visit to the Albany Institute of History & Art. Here, you can learn about the city's past and explore a range of exhibits. The institute is located at 125 Washington Ave, Albany, NY 12210, USA and can be contacted at (518) 463-4478.
- 12:00: After the museum visit, stop by Starvin' Marvin, a tea, cafe, Mexican, and Indian restaurant with an average cost of 20 dollars.
- 13:30: Travel to the New York State Museum, located at 222 Madison Ave, Albany, NY 12230, USA. Here, you can delve deeper into the history and culture of the state, with exhibits covering various topics. The museum can be contacted at (518) 474-5877.
- 16:30: Spend some time at the Schuyler Mansion State Historic Site, located at 32 Catherine St, Albany, NY 12202, USA. This site offers a glimpse into the past with its historic mansion and surrounding grounds. The site can be contacted at (518) 434-0834.
- 18:30: For dinner, try out Jahangeer Foods, a highly rated tea, pizza, Italian, BBQ, and cafe restaurant with an average cost of 59 dollars.

## Day 3: Thursday, March 24th, 2022
- 9:00: Head to the Albany Pine Bush Preserve, located at 195 New Karner Rd Suite 1, Albany, NY 12205, USA. This natural area offers hiking trails and the chance to connect with nature. The preserve can be contacted at (518) 456-0655.
- 12:00: Have lunch at Urban Punjab, a desserts, tea, pizza, Indian, Mediterranean, and seafood restaurant with an average cost of 63 dollars.
- 13:30: Check out the Discover Albany Visitors Center, located at 25 Quackenbush Square, Albany, NY 12207, USA. This centre provides information about the city and its attractions, along with potential discounts and special offers. Call (518) 434-1217 for more information.
- 15:00: Visit the Washington Park Lake House, situated at Washington Park Rd, Albany, NY 12203, USA. This park offers a peaceful retreat in the city, with a lake and surrounding greenery.
- 17:00: End your trip with a visit to the New York State Capitol, located at State St. and Washington Ave, Albany, NY 12224, USA. This impressive building holds significant political and historical value and can be contacted at (518) 474-2418.

Please be aware that the itinerary has been created with the information available to me and is, therefore, subject to change.

Enjoy your trip!
